dublinCore.dc:title: 114 HR 2606 IH: Roads Not Roses Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mrs. Hartzler (for herself, Mr. Sam Johnson of Texas, Mr. Issa, Mr. Hensarling, and Mr. Rokita) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

form.official-title: To amend title 23, United States Code, to discontinue funding for landscaping and scenic enhancement.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Roads Not Roses Act.

section.header: Landscaping and scenic enhancement funding discontinued

subsection.text: Section 319 of title 23, United States Code, is repealed.

Section 319 of title 23, United States Code, as in effect the day before the date of enactment of this Act, shall apply to landscape and roadside development as part of a construction project of Federal-aid highways if funds were obligated for the project before such date of enactment.
